location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, at Bombay to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a hole in the fabric of the folio. As a result, a small part of the body of the letter has been obscured.

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the commands of the Bombay Government, dated 12 January 1822. In response, it states that neither the Resident, nor Captain Sumley gave any indication to Ahmed Uzem [Aḥmad ‘Aẓīm] that his boats were safe from capture during an attack on Mocka [Al-Mukhā] by a British squadron.
